definition: to retreat in defeat
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
to retreat again and again in defeat/to suffer defeat after defeat

sentences.english: They laughed at retreat afterretreat of the American army.
sentences.chinese: 他们嘲笑美国军队一次又一次的败退。

sentences.english: But the friendship has been brilliant at times after losing ground.
sentences.chinese: 但友情却一直绚丽在时光节节败退后。

sentences.english: When the free and easy defeated retreat, the only sensitive to the laughter.
sentences.chinese: 当洒脱溃不成军节节败退时，只剩下敏感在狂笑。

sentences.english: The nations that resist that alliance are in retreat.
sentences.chinese: 抵抗这个同盟的国家在节节败退。

sentences.english: When the rear-guard of his army retreated, the front giving way too.
sentences.chinese: 当他的后卫撤走，前方也在败退。

sentences.english: The clouds ran across the sky as though in the flight from defeat.
sentences.chinese: 云阵像败退似地跑过天空。

definition: to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
utterly defeated/routed/crushed/to collapse (of army)
to retreat again and again in defeat/to suffer defeat after defeat
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
ruined army, defeated general (idiom); scattered remnants
defeated/routed
defeated remnants/scattered survivors
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
utterly defeated
to lose a war
to retreat
routed troops
to collapse on the first encounter/to give way at once
to make a surprise attack/to pounce on (an enemy)
to advance on sth/to press closely (on some goal)
